trans-unit.source: Stores linked resources to be sent as part of an e-mail message.
An instance of the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> class is returned by the <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.LinkedResources%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection"></xref>.
Call <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection.Dispose%2A> when you are finished using the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection>.
The <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> in an unusable state.

After calling <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection.Dispose%2A>, you must release all references to the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> occupied.

For more information, see [Cleaning Up Unmanaged Resources](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/unmanaged.md) and [Implementing a Dispose Method](~/docs/standard/garbage-collection/implementing-dispose.md).
This method invokes <xref:System.Net.Mail.AlternateView.Dispose%2A> on all views in this collection.
This method is called by the <xref:System.Net.Mail.MailMessage.Dispose%2A> method.
You do not need to call it in your application.
Always call <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection.Dispose%2A> before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using are not freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.Net.Mail.LinkedResourceCollection> object's `Finalize` method.
